response:
Urgent neuroimaging is required to visualise the extent of demyelination and exclude structural mimics. Differentiating between NMOSD and MS is critical for long-term management, requiring specific antibody testing (AQP4/MOG). Systemic screening is necessary to rule out infectious or vasculitic mimics.

investigations = ["MRI Brain and Spinal Cord with contrast", "Aquaporin-4 antibodies (NMO-IgG)", "Anti-MOG antibodies", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Autoimmune screen (ANA, ENA, ANCA)", "Lumbar Puncture", "Visual Evoked Potentials", "Optical Coherence Tomography", "Chest X-ray"]
